tit.e: The garden of the Heian-jingu Shrine
tit.cmt: ・「the」を削除・Title caseにしました

sen.j: 平安神宮神苑（へいあんじんぐうしんえん）は京都府京都市左京区にある池泉回遊式庭園の近代日本庭園。
sen.e: The garden of the Heian-jingu Shrine is a modern Japanese garden of Chisen Kaiyu style garden (a style of Japanese garden with a path around a central pond and spring) in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The garden of Heian-jingu Shrine is a modern Japanese garden of the chisen kaiyu style (a style of Japanese garden with a path around a central pond) in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を削除・「Chisen Kaiyu style garden」→「the chisen kaiyu style」・「and spring」を削除（用語変更）
sen.e: The garden of Heian-jingu Shrine is a modern Japanese garden of the chisen kaiyu style (a style of Japanese garden with a path around a central pond) in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 平安神宮の大極殿背後の周囲三方に配された南神苑、西神苑、中神苑、東神苑で構成される。
sen.e: It consisted of Minami (south) Shin en garden, Nishi (west) Shin en Garden, Naka (middle) Shin en garden, Higashi (east) Shin en Garden that enclose the three sides behind Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) of Heian-jingu Shrine..

It consists of Minami (south) Shin-en Garden, Nishi (west) Shin-en Garden, Naka (middle) Shin-en Garden, and Higashi (east) Shin-en Garden that enclose the three sides behind Heian-jingu Shrine Daigokuden.
sen.cmt: ・「consisted」→「consists」・スペースを削除・ハイフンを４つ追加・「and」を補足・「Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) of Heian-jingu Shrine」→「Heian-jingu Shrine Daigokuden」・「garden」→「Garden」
sen.e: It consists of Minami (south) Shin-en Garden, Nishi (west) Shin-en Garden, Naka (middle) Shin-en Garden, and Higashi (east) Shin-en Garden that enclose the three sides behind Heian-jingu Shrine Daigokuden.

sen.j: 面積は33,000㎡、作庭は小川治兵衛、国指定の名勝。
sen.e: It has an area of 33,000 square meters, and it is designed by Jihei OGAWA; it is designated as the scenic beauty of Japan.
It has an area of 33,000 square meters, was designed by Jihei OGAWA, and it has been nationally designated a place of scenic beauty.
sen.cmt: ・「and it is」→「was」・「;」→「, and」・「is」→「has been」・「nationally」を補足・「as」を削除・「the scenic beauty of Japan」→「a place of scenic beauty」
sen.e: It has an area of 33,000 square meters, was designed by Jihei OGAWA, and it has been nationally designated a place of scenic beauty.

sen.cmt: ・ハイフンを追加・コロンを追加・「garden」→「Garden」

sen.j: - 仙台市長が苗木寄贈した八重紅枝垂桜の名所
sen.e: - It was the famous place for double cherry blossom with weeping branch that was donated by Mayor of Sendai City
Famous for double weeping cherry trees donated by the mayor of Sendai City.
sen.cmt: ・「It was the famous place」→「Famous」・「double cherry blossom with weeping branch」→「double weeping cherry trees」・「that was」を削除・「Mayor」→「the mayor」・ペリオドを補足
sen.e: Famous for double weeping cherry trees donated by the mayor of Sendai City.

sen.cmt: ・「Azumaya (literally four eaves)」→「Arbor」・ペリオドを補足

sen.j: - 6月には池畔に200種2000株の花菖蒲が咲く、茶席「澄心亭」
sen.e: - Tea ceremony arbor `Choshin-tei' where two hundreds kinds of two thousands Japanese irises bloom in June
At the edge of the pond is a tea ceremony arbor named "Choshin-tei" where 2,000 Japanese irises of 200 varieties bloom in June.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: At the edge of the pond is a tea ceremony arbor named "Choshin-tei" where 2,000 Japanese irises of 200 varieties bloom in June.

sen.j: - 石柱は天正年間に豊臣秀吉が造営した三条大橋と五条大橋の橋脚の石材
sen.e: The stone pillar was made of stones from the legs of Sanjo-ohashi Bridge and Gojo-ohashi Bridge that Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI had built during Tenshu period (1573-1592)
The stone pillar is made of stones from the legs of Sanjo-ohashi Bridge and Gojo-ohashi Bridge, which were built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Tenshu period (1573-1592).
sen.cmt: ・「was」→「is」・「that」→「, which」・再構成・ペリオドを補足
sen.e: The stone pillar is made of stones from the legs of Sanjo-ohashi Bridge and Gojo-ohashi Bridge, which were built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI during the Tenshu period (1573-1592).

sen.j: - 京都御所から移築された建物
sen.e: - The building removed from Kyoto Imperial palace

sen.cmt: ・括弧を追加・「Guest」→「guest」・コロンを追加

sen.j: - 京都御所から移築された建物
sen.e: - The building removed from Kyoto Imperial palace

sen.j: 開門時間 600 - 1800（季節により変動）
sen.cmt: ・コロンを追加・「vary according to seasons」→「varies according to season」

sen.j: 年中無休（10月22日午後閉門）
sen.e: It opens 365 days a year (except for the afternoon of October 22)
Open 365 days a year (except for the afternoon of October 22)
sen.cmt: ・「It opens」→「Open」・余計スペースを削除
sen.e: Open 365 days a year (except for the afternoon of October 22)

sen.j: - 〒606 京都市左京区岡崎西天王町
sen.e: 〒606 Okazakinishi Tenno-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City
Okazakinishi Tenno-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, 606
Okazakinishi Tenno-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, 606

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線 東山駅下車 徒歩10分
sen.e: Take Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line for Higashiyama Station, and walk for ten minutes after getting off the station
Take the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line to Higashiyama Station, and walk for 10 minutes
sen.cmt: ・「the」を補足・「for」→「to」・「ten」→「10」・「after getting off the station」を削除
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line to Higashiyama Station, and walk for 10 minutes

sen.j: 京都市バス 5番・臨5番・27番・32番・46番で「京都会館美術館前」下車
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus No.5, extra service No.5, No.27, No.32, No.46 for `Kyoto Kaikan Hall Museum of Arts.'
Take the Kyoto City Bus No. 5, extra service No. 5, No. 27, No. 32 or No. 46 to 'Kyotokaikan Bijutsukan-mae'.
sen.cmt: ・「No.5」→「No. 5」 (x2)・「No.27」→「No. 27」・「No.32」→「No. 32」・「,」→「or」・「No.46」→「No. 46」・「for」→「to」・「`Kyoto Kaikan Hall Museum of Arts.'」→「'Kyotokaikan Bijutsukan-mae'」
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus No. 5, extra service No. 5, No. 27, No. 32 or No. 46 to 'Kyotokaikan Bijutsukan-mae'.
